name: Roger Wilson
text: Knowledgeable, friendly staff. Good selection. Easy to find.

name: Abra Rosen
text: Excellent service!

name: William Hill
text: Drinks galore

name: Corvo Shlorpe
text: Might be a great music place but I wouldn't recommend them for your media computer needs. Ill informed and try to cut corners that don't need to be cut.

name: Mark Sims
text:
Great people!!!!!!!!!
You won't find any better .
Been doing business with them for years , they will help you any way they can .

name: Foster Norris
text: Best store to buy musical and good people to deal with

name: Kerry Dyess
text: Best place I've ever been in. Nicest folks to deal with. Good Christian people.

name: Bennie Day
text: They go above and beyond to satisfy you.

name: Pimp Panda
text: Good Knowledgeable Service and a Very large selection don't let the size of the building fool you there's more in there than you'd think.

name: Mary Mason
text: Customer service was great. Very knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Jacob Nelson
text: Super exciting place people off the chart nice

name: Sharon Caldwell
text: My husband is alike a kid in a candy store when we go to Opp and visit Dyess!!! The owner is so knowledgeable and helpful have a prosperous 2019

name: Ron “Yogi” Terry
text: The address is correct as is the locator on the map, but the picture is wrong. Although it can be manipulated from present street view. 1 block off!

name: Wendell Ard
text: Great place to Shop and very Friendly people

name: Arnold Clewell
text: Huge selection- this place has an incredible inventory.

name: Kay Bellino
text: Great folks and lots of merchandise!!!

name: Dianne Mayo
text: Great place

name: Robin Ricks
text: Super-nice, knowledgeable people, huge selection, and they gave me a great deal!  Loved that I could try out so many different keyboards hands-on.  Highly recommend!

name: D M
text: Great selection of name brand pianos and organs including Yamaha and Hammond.  Their prices are very reasonable for what they sell.

name: Anna Soltani
text: I spoke in-depth with David Ellis about a Yamaha grand piano and he was very knowledgeable and extremely honest. He gave me so much of his time. I truly valued his opinion and would highly recommend Ellis Piano!

name: Fred Westrom
text:
Ellis Piano is a too notch shop.

They have a little of everything,
From entry level electric pianos,
All the way up to the nicest concert grands that money can buy.

You will not find a piano store with a better selection, and definitely not with nicer people.

They are not pushy, and are so friendly that they will spend a little extra time to show you how cool the products that you wish you could afford are.

If you are thinking of getting a piano, this is definitely the place to go, explore, play, learn, and eventually buy the piano that is right for you, and maybe even the piano of your dreams one day too.

Ask for Jason Ellis, and if you think of it, tell him that I sent you.

I am sure that you will be as impressed and satisfied as I have been with them.

name: Valencia King
text: Very friendly staff. Really good people. Awesome pianos.

name: john condon
text: (review by full-time pro-musician) Ellis is awesome! And take note, David Lambert is the in-house electronic repair "wizard" with a degree in Electrical Engineering. Awesome inventory of acoustic and the best in elec keys including NORD, KAWAI, ROLAND, YAMAHA, etc. Plus hybrids which are the latest designs that combine acoustic/elec by using a whole new trigger system that's NOT the midi triggers on each key which slows down the action. It's a completely new technology you have to see. Btw, if you walk in and don't know it there's a room in the back with over a $million in concert grands that blew my mind!

name: Jonathan Hart
text: Fantastic family-owned business! I was in the market looking for a new digital piano, and decided to check the place out. Got to talking with one of the family members named Jason about all sorts of piano-related topics. He showed me around the place, helped me get familiar with the layout of the store, answered questions I had about their keyboards, and overall was extremely helpful. Extremely passionate about what he does as well — I enjoyed discussing some of their piano history with him. Ended up purchasing a Roland FP-30 along with a stand and bench for a fantastic price! If you're in the market for anything piano-related, I would highly suggest Ellis Piano!

name: Christy Donovan
text: Our favorite piano music store. We try to visit every so often when we are in the Birmingham area. Great selection of music, and plenty of pianos to play it on to see if we like it.

name: Kristi Gill
text:
I went in for some general information and Cory helped me tremendously
5 stars go ellis oiano

name: Wendy Jessup
text: ❤️🎹❤️ Ellis Piano Store in Birmingham, Alabama, is filled with people who truly have compassion for their customers! Their dedication to excellence is off the charts! I have been shopping at Ellis for over ten years, and every time I walk into the store, they treat me like loving family! They have the very best pianos, accessories, and music at the very best prices! I am beyond pleased with the piano I bought from them! Every time I visit Ellis Piano Store I am blessed! It is the best and most loving family business I have ever seen! It will always be my favorite store!

resp.text: We're so glad you choose to shop with us for any piano needs you have! 10 YEARS? That's loyalty and we appreciate that so much.

name: Yun Jian
text: We bought our piano from here. They are have reliable services.

name: D mckenzie
text:
I would like to thank the Ellis family for such wonderful service and attention to our Church's needs. Please don't change a thing about how you do business in the community, because you are a pillar of excellence on how to provide awesome customer service and great products. Thank you again for a great experience on the phone and in the store.

Thanks Kindly
Greater Lily Star Baptist Church Family

name: Krystal McCarty
text: I cannot recommend Ellis Piano enough!  Jason and his dad, David, were absolutely amazing through the entire process of piano shopping and purchasing!  If you are in need of a piano (or sheet music) Ellis piano is hands down the place to go!  It is clear that they take pride in their work, and that they want the very best for all of their customers!

name: Mary Evans
text: Lots of choices and friendly employees.

name: Bob Clocker
text: Excellent place to do business. Helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.

name: Patrick Cash
text:
I can't say enough good things about my experience here. I had been looking, waiting, researching a Roland RD-2000. Finally stopped in and talked with Cory Ellis and then his Dad.
They both helped me and I felt very at home. Both were super nice and very friendly. You can tell they genuinely care about their customers. I would HIGHLY recommend Ellis Piano if you are needing a piano or keyboard. Check them out. You won't be disappointed.

name: Anabel Sanchez
text: We loved Ellis piano!  They go above and beyond and far as customer service!  Very kind people!

name: gail tucker
text:
After driving by this place for years with intent to stop in, I did finally stop in ... for only some piano music. I was greeted upon my entrance and made to feel welcome. I was definitely awestruck by the beauty of so many gorgeous pianos gathered in one place !
I was helped and allowed to browse through music and this adventure has added to my desire to begin playing My piano again .  I will definitely be back!

name: Dana
text: Had a great experience shopping here.  They were super patient while I looked at used pianos and then helpful when I finally made my decision to go electric.  When something would work with the Roland app they stopped by to see if they could help, even though I know they were having a super busy day.  And they checked back in with me months later to make sure an accessory had arrived.  Thanks y'all!

name: Jeremy Sams
text: These guys really made my dream come true of owning a Nord Piano  the customer service is outstanding ! Thank you guys! They are out doing their competition

name: Allen Jones
text: The purchase of my piano made a lifelong dream come true. Completing the experience was the service of the Ellis family. Family owned businesses have a pride and mindset like no other. Fully attuned to my interests and needs, the Ellises guided me to just the right piano and provided excellent delivery service and guidance on long term care for the piano. I cannot imagine a better experience and am deeply grateful. Sincerely, Allen Jones

name: Allison Walls
text: If you're in need of a piano or keyboard, this is the place to go.  They are not only experts in their field, but they will make you feel extremely comfortable and right at home.  My mom is a private piano teacher and has shopped here for as long as I can remember.  They have, by far, the best selection in Alabama, and their floor room is filled with absolutely beautiful pianos.  Mr. Ellis and his sons are honest and loyal, and we will never buy from anywhere else.  Do yourself a favor when piano shopping and just make one stop here.

name: Tiffany Walls
text: Mr. Ellis and his sons are amazingly kind, knowledgeable and honest. My wife's family have been friends and patrons of Mr. Ellis for decades. We would recommend Ellis Piano for the purchase or repair of your piano. You'll never feel more like family than you would here. The store is set up beautifully and these guys will take the time to walk you through features, the history of each piano and feel out your needs to make sure you find the perfect addition to your home and family.

name: Luca Guazzotto
text: Great store for piano buyers. Cory and David are very helpful. They will spend the time to knowledgeably talk with you about the various instruments and to let you try on even the ones that are above your goal or budget. They won't press you into buying anything, nor try to convince you that some expensive piano is "the best piano in the world" or that some cheap one is a great deal. I didn't buy a piano, but I will definitely be back for one when I am ready.

name: Brian Farrar
text: Talk about a class act organization. My wife and I purchased a baby grand piano from this loving and welcoming establishment in September  of 2017. After having the instrument in our home for 4 months 2 keys at the very far end of the piano were sticking. I called Mr. Ellis told him the problem and he sent out a professional to fix it in a very timely manner. Not only did they fix the 30 second minor problem Mr. Ellis had my piano tuned at no expense to us. If that is not customer service I don't know what is. If anyone who reads this post is contemplating purchasing a piano please please please rest assure from the time you meet Mr. Ellis, his sons, and the staff that work there, you will be well taken care of. These people are genuine from the word go. They will assist you if you know absolutely nothing about  a piano to help you find the right instrument for you. Words cannot express how wonderful this business is. Thank you, thank you, thank you Ellis Piano & Organ for being who you are.

name: Enoch Ko
text: I recently purchased a Yamaha gc2 from Ellis Piano. Mr. Ellis and Cory were fantastic from showing me their inventory all the way to purchasing. Very approachable and down to earth people. Fantastic people. They could not have made the buying experience any easier. Piano also arrived quickly and I could not be happier with the purchase. Highly recommended.

name: Andrew Carter
text: They have a great selection of pianos and sheet music!!! Music for all skill levels and all genres! Music Staff is super friendly, very knowledgeable and always willing to help!

name: David Porter
text: You might as well call this "World of Pianos" because it is FILLED with beautiful new and used instruments. Mr. Ellis and his sons are wonderful people who will go out of their way to help and will work with you to get the right piano in your home. They have a wealth of experience and knowledge. If you are thinking of buying a new or used piano, sheet music or electronic keyboard, you owe it to yourself to check with Ellis Piano.

name: Kim Beverage
text: Ellis piano is simply THE BEST place to not only buy a piano but to enjoy the experience of doing so.  Purchasing a piano is a matter of very personal taste and preference...what matters most to David Ellis and his sons is quite simply whatever matters most to you.  My husband recently surprised me by taking me to Ellis to pick out the piano of my dreams.  While they could have pushed me to purchase on the spot, they did exactly the opposite and accommodated me on multiple visits to make certain I went home with the instrument I not only liked....but with which I fell in love (as did my husband).  They went out of their way to educate us about the instruments and encouraged me not to settle.  Not once did I feel pushed to make a purchase.  David and his sons knew this was a very special gift from my husband and they went above and beyond to make sure it was all he wanted for me...and all I wanted as well.  The Ellis family knows pianos, they know the value of a good investment, they know the value of superior customer service, they are approachable and meet every pianist on their level - from the young child just beginning lessons to the most accomplished world-renown performers and everyone in between and they treat them all with the same utmost care and respect.  When you select a piano from Ellis, you receive not only a stellar instrument suited just for you, but also the benefit of a family legacy based on fulfilling musicians’ dreams.  If you’re in the market for a piano, question no further where you should go...Ellis Piano is your answer.

name: Gary Kendrick
text: Wonderful visit with the Ellis family.

name: Anja Willis
text: Very knowledgeable staff

name: Susan Hanshue
text: My mother was in the store thus past Monday and was very pleased not only with her purchase but the service as well. Cory and Jason were great on all counts. She received a good deal and great service.

name: Ken Schmidt
text: Awesome Store!

name: Eric Morrison
text: Place is awesome. Family owned business, they go out of their way to accommodate their customers. Salesman walked around explaining everything to us and playing so we could hear the difference between the pianos. Great experience.

name: Deborah Hatchett
text: Very personable and ease of purchasing.

name: Dustin Wheat
text: I recently bought a digital piano at an wonderful price for my family from this store. The owner and his family of employees helped me choose the right piano that suited our needs. They took the time to help me with all my concerns. I truly felt taken cared of from start to finish with the purchase. I will be sure to go back if I need anything else.

name: Roxanne Kutzer
text: My family and I were so excited to purchase our first digital piano and the experience of buying it at Ellis just contributed to that. David, our sales rep, asked us some simple questions about our playing experience and goals and helped us find a great entry-level piano that suits our needs. We're really pleased with our purchase and will return when we're ready to upgrade!

name: Robin Leece
text: The owner and his son as well as all the other staff were kind, considerate and professional with obvious integrity. I enjoyed my visit and would only buy a piano here. I wish more of today's business owners took this much pride in their work and were as sincere in helping customers!

name: Batman 67C
text: AWESOME STAFF!!!!! One of the employees went out of his way to show/ tell me about practically everyone of the pianos in the main showroom!! Had the best time in here!! Will definitely be buying a piano from here in the future!!

name: ines villarreal
text:
The Ellis family is one of a kind. Since the first time I walked in, till I finally left with my piano, they were stupend, thoughtful, and inquisitive.

The father has all of his boys working at the store, which makes it seem like if you were coming home for lunch. They always have good suggestions and fun stories to tell.  On top of that, they are experts on the subject of music, piano and organs.

name: Sue Oden
text: There is something wonderful about coming to Ellis Piano to browse through their music.  I am always treated so courteously and feel valued and wanted as a customer.  This is a rare experience in today's society.  I don't feel like a transaction; I feel somewhat like family.

name: Lisa Hall
text: Salesman David was so nice. He was very informative about the product. Very pleasant experience

name: Matthew Langkamer
text: Great selection of classical and pop sheet music. And about three dozen pianos I wanna buy.

name: Clay Barnett
text: Great service and helpful folks explaining things. Good sheet music collection too.

name: Coby Fuson
text: An awesome place with awesome pianos and kind people.

name: Jill Carter
text: I love this place.  They are always so helpful and kind. And because I am a teacher, I recieve 10%off. Which is so wonderful of them.

name: Angela Manasco
text: Wonderful experience. Knowledgeable friendly staff. Excellent selection for every budget

name: Ricardo Pedraza
text: Beautiful piano selection with very friendly personnel. If looking for a good piano this is the place.

name: StevieD Life Vids
text: Worked with Cory who had watch my wife and I come in a few times over the years.  We finally narrowed down our options in the price range we were looking to spend.  Couldn't be happier with the purchase.  Delivery and setup were perfect and we had no issues.  I would buy from them again!

name: Casey Middlebrooks
text: You can always tell when you buy from a quality, family owned business.  The folks at Ellis Piano were very courteous, knowledgeable, and helped us pick out the best piano for our needs.  I would highly recommend buying from Ellis Piano.

name: Brenda Reaves
text: Wonderful experience all the way around! Great Piano, Great Price and Great Service, what more can you ask? :) This piano is a gift for our son, who is graduating college as a piano major and he picked it out. See Chris Reaves review for more details, he's my husband.

name: Chris Byrd
text: Beautiful selections

name: Linda Bartlett
text: They are always very helpful and they usually carry the music that I need for my students.

name: John Green
text: Beautiful, beautiful piano's. The staff is awesome. Very friendly.

name: Kim Vinson
text: David, Corey and Jason Ellis were very helpful recently in helping me choose and purchase a nice upright piano. The staff at Ellis Piano is always very helpful in meeting my needs either as a singer, piano teacher or purchasing an instrument.

name: Rus Hardy
text: Some of the friendliest people around!!  Great selection.

name: Virginia Blackwood
text: Best music store I have ever been in!

name: TImothy Burns
text: Incredible selection of fine pianos

name: Tony Riddle
text: We have always had a great experience dealing with the staff at Ellis Piano.

name: Aaron Joyner
text: Beautiful Pianos and helpful, knowledgeable staff.

name: Joel Hinkle
text: Great people and great deals

name: George Benson
text: Great selection of acoustic and digital pianos.

name: Sylvia Jones Davis Stevenson
text: Great

name: jessie pugh
text: Nice, helpful staff

name: Anand Iyer
text: Mr. Kannon (accompanied by his wife) did a great job tuning our ancient piano. I really felt like he went above and beyond in replacing a number of parts and was very realistic about the results we were going to get.

name: Synbad
text: These people are garbage. Just a warning to band parents or anyone who plays an instrument. My sister took her flute to them to have the pads replaced. She paid 250.00 up front and was promised that the work would be done by a certain day. She was lied to on several occasions and yelled at on the phone by the owner. My dad went to retrieve her flute and they refused to return it and called the cops on him. She went today to get the flute back. She was able to get it and returned their flute (which was a cheaper flute). They refused to refund the money however,  even though no work was done to it. Do not spend your money at this store, it isn't worth it.

name: Zac Wood
text: DO NOT DO BUSINESS HERE! Jason Oden is the most disrespectful and unprofessional business man, if you can even call him such, that I have ever encountered. Stole my wife and sister-in-law's pool table after putting it on consignment at his store. After ignoring for over a year, they were cussed out of the store when they went to pick it up. Completely denies even the receipt/paperwork from his company. No evidence at all of the table. He is the definition of a true criminal! Pure evil! Please, don't make the mistake of even walking in the door. Please spread the word to save as many people as possible from being scammed by this corrupt establishment!

name: Elizabeth Kitchens
text: I absolutely love the customer service. They have speedy service of having my items returned back to me better than they ever have been. I will definitely continue to bring instruments and furniture to these guys!!!

name: Krissy Wood
text:
WORST experience EVER!
THIEVES! THIEVES! THIEVES!
They stole our pool table that we had on consignment with them!
I would not recommend anyone doing any business with them!

name: jason oden
text: Store under new management and wide open. Business is great and strong, thanks to the LAST 17 folks we moved AND OR set up THIS LAST WEEK.  Come see our Brunswick selection.

name: Isabella Reaves
text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Absolutely horrible people. They talk down to people, they are theives, and are very unprofessional and childish. NEVER EVER EVER GO HERE. Please don't go here. You will be ripped off, and cheated.

name: (STUDENT)Ashley Read
text: Horrible person. Stole my grandmothers piano. Thieves and evil people. Plz do not do business with them.

name: Robie Lynn
text: Cold and damp in store making pianos not play correct...music selection very low

name: Johannes Petursson
text:
This review is for my experience *consigning* with A B Stephens. If you are a buyer, just know that as a customer myself, I have no complaints.

I consigned my piano with them in February of 2020. The pickup process was quick and easy and they were pleasant to work with. The piano sold in about 5 months.

Fast forward to now, and I've only just received my check for the sale, over a year later. I reached out to them multiple times prior to the sale for an update without any substantive response, and they failed to notify me of the sale to coordinate sending the check (I had recently moved) until I remembered to ask them again. To their credit, they were quick to solve the problem and Laurin was responsive and considerate given the circumstances. You'll see her comment below reacting to my original review, which I've edited to reflect the conclusion of this situation.

If you consign with them and call regularly for updates, you will have no problems. If you expect them to have your information on hand and reach out proactively, you might have problems.

To A B Stephens - I support your business and I recognize that there was no ill intent. You expose yourself to a lot of risk when this happens, and I encourage you to improve your documentation tools to avoid it happening again. Customer relationship management (CRM) software is more accessible than ever; it'll make your lives easier, your customers happier, and your business more resilient.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Petursson, Please call the store. My name is Laurin and I'll take care of it.

name: Ian Swepston
text:
Bought a pre-owned upright from them

Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Was also pleased with the price and quality they provided. I would definitely recommend them

name: Cynthia Buchheit
text: Very nice, professional, helpful, and knowledgeable staff. Good selection and prices.

name: Jennifer Ferrero
text: There was a large collection of piano sheet music. My husband and I were delighted since we both play! We also checked out/drooled over the baby grand pianos. We were pretty surprised because the prices were very reasonable. The owner (?) was very helpful and kind. We will definitely be returning for more sheet music once the time comes.

name: Ronald Bunner
text: Service was polite and the store had a good selection of pianos.

name: Tricia Hutchinson
text: Friendly nice place..

name: Gabe Arnold
text: This a piano shop and a music school with the friendliest of people. They do vocal lessons and i believe insturmental lessons.

name: Karen Hawkins
text: Took kids to pick out piano sheet music. They had a great selection which allowed for my kids to select some classical, ragtime and Disney music. I'm so glad they're still there-- they've been there since my childhood!

name: Erin Sizemore
text: Have used this place for almost 17  years! Great place for sheet music where you can try out the music before buying. Knowledgeable staff who are quite friendly!

name: Kristen Alexander
text: Customer service is excellent and we are thrilled with our new piano.

name: Kerri Dyer
text: I LOVE being able to walk into a music store and pick up the books and decide which music I want to buy, or which music would be right for my students.   That is something that is truly difficult to do online. The people here are so helpful and friendly.    I try to support this brick-and-mortar store, because, if we don't, we won't have this great community resource anymore.

name: Kay Campbell
text: Very well-informed staff who are themselves musicians. Good studio for lessons.

name: Brenda Peacher
text: Very helpful and nice people,  always go above and beyond for you!

name: Carl McGuire
text: Friendly,  informative, but not overbearing. Prices good as net. Just a good place to buy a piano. Need a piano...give them a try.

name: John S.
text:
Though business has certainly declined over the years, this place is still a local staple. They have a nice display of pianos, and a well-stocked sheet music department with very friendly and helpful staff. Just about any piano piece you need will probably be in stock here, and if not, they will order it.
I do have just one gripe- for some reason there are several desks by the front door where you walk in. There are always people working at these desks, and I have no idea who they are, but when you walk in, they all look up and stare at you. Quite awkward and uncomfortable.

name: Travis
text: The most helpful staff and wide variety of music. They offer many things from equipment, instruments, music, and helpful staff which are patient and extremely informative.

name: Kathy Thompson
text: A wonderful music store! Love looking for good Music for myself & my students there!

name: Trayc
text: We purchased a clarinet for our child and tf service was friendly, speedy and I could tell we were appreciated.

name: Brad McClellan
text: Helpful and they have a good selection, pianos and electric pianos, keyboards.

name: Julie Cronan
text: Very friendly staff with a great music selection!

name: Suezy Proctor
text: Knowledgeable, friendly good advice...will be back

name: Melinda Beck
text: Awesome store for all kinds of music and pianos.

name: Gwyn Williams
text: Best selection of sheet music in North Alabama.

name: Dave Jackman
text: Good variety of music and pianos. Not much else there though.

name: Keisha Fortson
text: Polite enough, but not interested in my business.

name: George Benson
text: Great selection of keyboards, guitars and other music accessories.

name: Chad
text: They had a few Yamaha P115 and P225 on display, but no Yamaha DGX. If it's your first time there, follow the signs to the back door.

name: Arlie “Santa” Woolard
text: Helpful, well stocked,  and convenient!

name: Jimmy Johnson
text: Super knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful staff.

name: Susan Adams
text: Local business.  Long open, since 1970's at least.

name: Jimmy Nance
text: They do good service

name: Chad
text: They had a few Yamaha P115 and P225 on display, but no Yamaha DGX. If it's your first time there, follow the signs to the back door.

name: Missy Fantusi
text: Saw a recital in the building next door

name: Cobain P
text: WOW!!!! Amazing store, with great stock, at great prices, with even better customer service!!! Felt so welcomed as soon as I got two steps in the store, by one of THE best salesman that I’ve ever met in my life!!! I will always do any & all my music shopping here!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Great people are hard to find but we are really blessed in finding people who still care about the customers.

name: Steve W
text:
I had an absolutely great experience in this huge, well-stocked store. Salesperson, Erskine, was awesome. No pressure, very helpful, patiently letting me try out one guitar after another to make sure I was happy with the amp.

I could have bought this on-line and had it shipped for free and saved $85 in taxes - but I felt the experience was worth paying a little more, and worth supporting a local (non-chain) business.

There are some negative reviews here. I’m sure with doing a lot of sales and service, someone won’t be happy. But I did not experience anything but great gear, and a helpful no-pressure salesman.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Great people are hard to find but we are really blessed in finding people who still care about the customers. Erskin has been selling in Birmingham for over 25 years we are lucky to have such a caring salesperson.

name: Fretjoe
text: Great people to do business, they were the only place in Alabama that could fix our churches Roland keyboard.  Great service, thank you!!

name: Dave Cleveland
text:
I was driving back to Franklin Tn today from Ga and stopped in the shop.
Everyone was extremely kind and the store looked great!
I was super impressed with John in the electric room. Not only did they stock the “must have pedals” they also had pedals that help players find and define their individual sound.
John had a thorough knowledge of all the gear in the room. I highly recommend the shop!!
Dave

resp.text: Thanks, Dave for the kind words. 2020 has been really strange for all of us. It's been really hard to keep everything in stock. Hope to see you soon and send someone to see us.

name: Ben
text: We love Bailey Brothers. They are personable, they have good prices, and they fix you up with everything you need. If you're in the market for a guitar, be sure to ask for Joseph.

resp.text: Thanks Ben, Joe is a real asset here at bailey brothers .

name: Joel Pearson
text:
I just want to say I am completely blown away by the level of customer service that I received on my last purchase. I didn't really think about writing a review after the first guitar that I bought there, but now that I have another experience from a major purchase I just had to say something to the public.
Over the years I have also purchased smaller items because it was convenient to me to stop by and get things like cables, picks, capos, and other little odds and ends for guitar and bass that I use. This time I bought a relatively inexpensive guitar there; an epiphone Les Paul special, in the TV yellow color. I even traded another guitar towards it.  I thought they were very fair on their trade value and reasonable in their explanation of how that works. The reason I feel like I had an exceptional experience was they treated me very good even though the $ value I was spending wasn't that high. Looking back I was thinking that I don't think I could have gotten a better experience even if I had been purchasing a $2,500 Gibson! I felt like a valued customer and they answered all of my quirky questions and help me find a hardshell case that was in my budget and I am very happy with the final price and how the deal worked out.
Please go patronize this business. They deserve it because they work hard for their customers and they let you know if something is within their ability to produce or not. They have my business from now on because of how I was treated on this deal and looking back on other deals too. I think their prices are fair they are better than retail. Overall, I am super excited about my purchase and very happy with my experience with Bailey Brothers music company.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review .  We aim to please , Blown away is our goal for sure .

name: Charlie Thompson
text: The best stock in Alabama and possibly the Southeast. Great helpful people who  offer installation, rentals and Backline. Ben is GM and Joseph is an incredible luthier. Worth your time to stop and look.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words . That means a lot coming from you .

name: JOSH DRUMMOND
text: Good selection of musical equipment. Be prepared because they strictly enforce the muzzle mandate inside. They make you wear masks.

resp.text: Thanks for the compliment on our selection.   We're not enjoying the mask mandate, but we are trying to follow the rules to keep everyone safe.  We look forward to seeing everyone's faces again soon.

name: Robin Joshi
text: Ask them if you can try out one of their 5k+ custom shop stratocasters, and they'll hand it to you just like that. No sweat.

resp.text: We love the good stuff and we hope everyone else does to . The right gear does matter. Thanks for the 5-star review.

name: Sean Callahan
text: These guys are the best! Ben is very knowledgable, honest, responsive and personable. He is very easy to talk to and work out any potential sales with. He has helped me out a lot and I have bought a few products with them including a Gibson and some Boss pedals. The customer service experience has been outstanding and the site is also very convenient given it has a live chat agent. Can't recommend enough! Check them out! Thanks Bailey Brothers Music Company!

name: Hellonwheels999 (Hellonwheels999)
text: Went to look for Double bass drum pedals. The initial phone call, drums guy was polite, explained and answered questions in a manner that didnt feel rushed or annoyed. Off to the store. The Drums guy showed me their selection and prices, explained a little about each set then backed off and let me make a decision without the classic Guitar Center upsell attempt "just buy this one because [ insert cheesy sell line here] ". Dude that spoke volumes about this store, they werent watching people like police, *cough* Guitar center *cough* they have a better product than other stores in particular the Mapex $119 double bass set has better reviews and looks more sturdy than the Mapex double bass pedals sold at GC for $129 on sale at time of this review for $119. Then on to sticks, again took time to understand what i wanted and what i was desiring to recommend the right product and not the top dollar one! Now off to the front counter, set my stuff down at the reg and told them i was going to wait because i also needed guitar strings. I naturally went for Ernie Ball, but the cashier guy began to tell me about different brand he uses, explained why and also hit all the issues with strings i was having on the head. Its nice to go to music store where people are actually musicians and know what theyre talking about and selling. I definitely will be back. AND i definitely will tell anyone who asks about a music store about them!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words!

name: Brent Thompson
text: Usually get good service, but I took my guitar nut to be repaired after my guitar took a spill. I let them know the guitar had fallen and hoped they would fix. The nut was replaced poorly but the guitar had a buzz. Took it back 2 more times. The last visit, the person in charge of the repair (2 weeks later)said I had heavy fingers and raised the stings to a height that made the guitar unplayable. I took to another repair shop and they repaired the nut replaced by Bailey Brothers found a couple of uneven frets repaired  the frets adjusted the neck and had to re-setup the guitar from the disaster repair at Bailey Brothers. If in need of repairs I will never return to this store.

name: joe law
text: Just bought my dream guitar here.  The guitar guy, Erskine Milton, Was very accommodating and patient with me.  I played several very nice guitars and he was all too willing to help me in any way.  I love my new 58 VOS Les Paul Custom.  Thank you Erskine for taking the time to help me pick my perfect guitar!!!!

resp.text: Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the guitar is still sounding great. Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us. Thank you for the business and Erskin is the bomb for sure. drop by and tell them I said for you to get a new bbmc shirt.

name: Danny Kircus
text: I have bought a LOT of equipment from these guys over the years.  They have the best brands at good prices.  Always super nice and knowledgeable about their products.  My go to music store in central Alabama.  They are like family.  We are lucky to have them here.

resp.text: Danny , Thank You for the 5 Star review. The people on the floor really do a great job of helping. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us.

name: Brandon Martin
text: Super friendly and helpful staff.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Great people are hard to find but we are really blessed in finding people who still care about the customers. .

name: Joseph Beavers
text: Best guitar store in Alabama! Took my Les Paul in for a pickup swap and they fixed three other problems with it and didn't even charge me for it! I was so impressed that I bought an amp the same day! Thanks guys!

resp.text: Joseph, Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the Les Paul is still sounding great. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us.  Thank you for the business

name: Teddy Jamieson
text: Do NOT trust for online sales.  I found a  guitar in their website, comminucated back and forth for a few days. Decided to pull the trigger and put a deposit down while I waited on a new card. Received a call 5 days after I paid that the item hadn't been sold but was "promised" to an employee and even though I paid they would not offer the transaction. S H A D Y business.

resp.text:
I AM SORRY BUT this guy has worked there for 10 years and never ask to buy a guitar. He had asked the salesperson to hold it for him while he got his dollars together. it just did not get taken out of the computer has available, our mistake. Sorry, but he had made a promise and it was important to keep it. Your salesman could have just told you there was a crack in the headstock and you would have been fine but he was honest with you thinking you would understand. I understand you feel you were mistreated. if there is anything I can do to make you happy I will. please hit the salesperson up and tell him Clyde told you to ask for a deal on anything you see on the website or special order you may like a killer deal on. the salesperson you were dealing with is one of our VIP services masters.  Just tell him to ask CLYDE for the deal.
Again I am sorry.

name: Howler Wolf
text:
Recently brought a used instrument to these guys to be cleaned and conditioned. They charged $230 and I'm not really sure what they did beyond $40 worth of repairing. I even priced the individual parts myself and they cost a total of $23. The instrument was very dirty and they didn't even do a good or complete job of wiping it down. We didn't get any paperwork explicitly stating what they were going to do so we can't really argue the point. The inside of the instrument wasn't even touched during cleaning because there is obvious dust and grime that was there when we gave it to these guys.

We also bought a mouthpiece for the instrument, I previously priced it at $10 online and it was $35 at this place. An outrageous markup.

All of this was after agreeing to a monthly payment for an instrument only to be informed the day before it was needed that they didn't have any in stock so we had to scramble to find a different option. Because of this, they also didn't send us a cleaning kit for the instrument that had been fully paid for.

I will be looking for another place for any other instrument needs.

name: Richard Hlavaty
text:
Bought a Takamine in the Montgomery BBM store 1995, and recently had some fret work. It plays like new.
Thanks Clay, for the great customer service, and putting me on a guitar to suit my playing needs 👍

resp.text: Thanks big man  Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the Takamine  is still killer. Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see me. Thank you for the business over the years and i think you should start a cooking webcast on face book. Your stuff looks good enough to eat.  If you are in b-ham come see me.

name: James Wood
text: Amazing selection. Employees were really helpful in finding the right guitar for me.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and we are so happy you found the right guitar. Let us know what next and how you are doing on your musical journey soon. Send someone to see us. Thanks again

name: BIll McClain
text: Easily the best music store in Bham.  Great selection, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Always have what I need!

name: Walter Rosen
text: Love the products and love the service

resp.text: We try to hire the best we can find . Thanks for the Great review.

name: Tanner Jones
text: Very friendly customer service, and they worked extremely quickly to get my order shipped. Definitely recommend using them!

resp.text: Tanner, Thank You for the 5 Star review. The people here do a great job of helping. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us at baileybrothers.com.

name: Mc Spankies
text: Bought two instruments here an epiphone Sheraton and a epiphone eb 3 and a fender rumble 40. They were very patient and worked out a great deal and didnt rush or push me. 10/10 definitely shop here again

resp.text: Mr Spankey , Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the gear is still sounding great. Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us. Thank you for the business

name: Craig Winn
text: Very helpful staff. My two kids want to start playing guitar and violin. The salesperson was patient in helping the kids and was not condescending at all. He was patient and even helped my left handed child decide if she needed a right or left handed guitar. Turns out that even though she is very left handed the right handed guitar felt better. Also their stick was very impressive.  Lots and lots of stuff everywhere.

name: Jacob Hazelwood
text: It was my first time in the store and I had an excellent experience. David was very helpful and friendly as well as the other staff present. The online site lacks a lot of the guitars they have in stock because they get new guitars a lot so I would advise actually going into the store to see their wide selection.

name: Allen Mark Russell
text: Great selection of quality guitars and a staff that is knowledgeable about what they sell.

name: K Benoit
text:
This place is as good as, if not better than, Guitar Center. But this one man that works there is not the friendliest and makes me and my music buddy never wanna come again... I was gonna buy at least $20-$60 of stuff, and my buddy was gonna get his guitar worked on, but we decided against it after our experience today.
My friend and I were playing our guitars together at moderate volumes. No louder than the other customers that passed through. Our volume knobs probably were set around 1. This rude clerk guy came up to us and told us "turn it down, there are customers in here". When there was maybe 1 other guy in the guitar room at most. What are we, trash? Are we not customers?
Though to be fair, there was a little kid who sat behind us who was louder than both of us combined, and he was tremolo picking the most random nonsensical annoying noise (future shredder?), but he should've told the kid to turn down—not us. We both turned our amps off because he was rude the last time we were in the store and we were pretty annoyed at this point. But the kid turned his amp down and continued the random picking and the dude immediately came back and said "hey, okay, turn it off, that's enough for today" and took the guitar from the kid. The rudest music store clerk we've ever encountered. There's another guy who is super nice that works there who let us turn the volume up—at least 2 or 3 times what we did today—and test every amp in the store. We bought a $2,000 setup from the nice guy in the past, but this rude guy would probably kick us out of the store before we could make a purchase. I didn't catch his name, but he's average height, blondish, his hair is thinning, and he had a short beard. A nicer worker told us he's been there 3 years, though I'm not sure how he's lasted that long. He'll probably follow you around like you're a thief and ask if he can help you 8 times like he did to us the last time we came in the store simply to buy a cable.

name: CLAY BAILEY
text: This place has always been good to me.

name: Ryan Burke
text: It was my first time in here recently and I had a pleasant experience. David made sure I felt welcomed and was very helpful in answering any questions I had. Overall they have a great selection and friendly staff.

name: Johnathan Weldon
text: Great people, great deals, great customer service! Whether you’re buying online or in person, you’ll be glad you shopped with these guys. I have done business with them for a long time, just bought a new Fender Strat and couldn’t be more pleased with the product and the service, they always go above and beyond. I  will definitely return, like I always have.

name: Tyler Brown
text: These guys are always super helpful.

resp.text: Tyler, Thank You for the 5 Star review. The people on the floor really do a great job of helping. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us.

name: Ben A
text: Kevin was very helpful in fixing my guitar I purchased over a year ago. Was having some issues with my saddle and strings breaking every show for the last few weeks. Fixed it in just a few minutes and restrung my instrument for a Very affordable price. Love the guys at bailey brothers.

name: Allie
text: Super nice store full of super helpful people. I visited this location three times in one day, as I was undecided and trying to deal with the idiots at Guitar Center, and each time, a really nice gentleman, Erskine, helped me. He went back, spent the time finding the guitar I was after, took it out of the box even when I wasn't for sure on buying it, and tuned it for me. Ultimately, his attitude, kindness, and knowledge was what sold me on my guitar. After the run around at Guitar Center, he was just what I needed. Thank you so much!

name: Chris Peters
text: I love shopping at Bailey Bros on 280. The sales staff is great, especially one of the guys named Sammy. He is always very helpful and knowledgeable. He always helps me find the perfect gear for me. Good prices and excellent service. Over all, I always have a great experience shopping there.

name: Talia Ledbetter
text: Kindest and most knowledgeable employees I’ve experienced. They deserve anyone’s business who is interested in learning more about music or getting their gear improved. Todd particularly is super nice and helpful.

name: Dustin Reaves
text: Always very friendly and service oriented.

resp.text: Dustin thank you for the 5 star rating . We have a great crew and we really love sharing the joy of music. Follow us on Facebook or look for deals at baileybrothers.com .  Thank you again.

name: Kristen Russo
text: My daughter has taken drum lessons at Bailey Brothers for over nine months now. We could not be happier. The customer service we receive from the front desk is wonderful, and her teacher, Leif, is so nice and is an excellent drummer and instructor. The price for their lessons is very competitive, and they are conveniently located. I couldn't ask for more!

name: Mark Pyle
text:
This full service family owned music store is the best I have ever shopped at. The staff is very knowledgeable about the products and that is rare in this market of corporate box stores. Do yourself a favor and go see them before you make a purchase....It's well worth the drive.

Dr. Mark Pyle
Florence, AL

name: Owen Stayner/ThisWorkplace360
text:
Purchased a Les Paul Bass here years ago-- still enjoying it.
Thank you BB Music.

name: James Summers
text: It was really nice and organized. The people who helped me where real nice and even tho my age they still talked to me in a professional tone.

name: Sky Morriss
text: I can't speak for the rest of the people who work there but I spoke to a man about selling a saxophone and he was the rudest clerk I have ever encountered. If you need a music store, try Art's! They're right across the street and are actually nice to their customers.

name: Silven Cox
text: Hands down my favorite store in the Birmingham area. Great staff, and good selection.

name: Amber Nicole
text: good staff well organize not bad products

resp.text: Thank You for the 3 Star review?  Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site . Please send someone to see us. Thank you for the business and  drop by and tell them I said for you to get a new bbmc shirt. I HOPE WE CAN IMPROVE ON THE 3 STAR REVIEW.

name: Andrew Krist
text:
Had a pretty poor experience the one time I went to Bailey Brothers Music.

I went there to trade in a partscaster tele for a guitar pedal. I started looking at some envelope filters and some guy came out of the back trying to tell me that envelope filters are only for bass players. Told him about the dead and others, and he changed his stance from “auto wahs are for bass only” to “well the mu-trons are for bass and the Q-trons are for guitar”.

First of all, Jerry Garcia, Trey Anastasio, Keller Williams and countless others use mu trons in their guitar rigs. Second, the Q-tron is just a pedal made by EHX that’s also an envelope filter. Hell people use MXR’s bass envelope filters on their guitar rigs. So the overall musical knowledge when it came to pedals wasn’t very high in my experience.

Also, when I went to trade my partscaster in, the guy offered me $125 for it. I later learned that this was a pretty bad lowball, as I got offered $200 at a much smaller guitar store. At first I said $125 was fine, if he would bring the price on a boss envelope filter down from $130 to $125. The guy said no, on a five dollar difference. I ended up taking my guitar somewhere else and (thank god) getting $200 for it.

I’m giving this place two stars because they did have a large selection. Not a super interesting selection, but large. Also the staff was friendly, although not as knowledgeable as I’d hoped. Sadly I will not be going back to Bailey Brothers.

resp.text: SORRY FOR THE BAD EXPERANCE , sounds terrible. I wish i knew what the guys name was who waited on you . I would bet he is no longer here.  we have the best guys here , we do hire new guys that sometime dont work out because they cant learn the gear, sorry again and not sure we deserve 2 stars but would love the chance to improve on that .

name: Bebe Stringfield
text: We always go here for our musical needs. I love the place. They are always friendly and helpful. I would recommend any musician to this place.

name: Coleman Haines
text: This place is awesome, need customer service? DONE! Need a repair? DONE! Need to place an order? DONE! The only thing I did not like was the lack of extended range instruments. You will not be finding fanned fret, 28 fret, tap guitar, etc. You want those go to WARR guitars or order them off of a musicians website.

name: John Watson
text: Great place for electric & acoustic guitars with huge selection of amps also.Kevin is a wizard with guitars.Shop here before buying

name: Linda Pierre
text: I needed 2 wireless mics for our church's old PA system. They are so helpful! They want to make sure that what you purchase from them will work! Nothing like good customer service!

name: Wrath
text:
Dishonest, and disrespectful. While I'm aware they have an "all sales final" on used gear policy, it is their responsibility to properly inspect the gear they take in and not sell something that is damaged internally (in my case, a guitar amp). Idiot salesman also had a smug grin on his face the whole time my brother and I were having to deal with it (all 5-6 hours) and was making snooty comments back and forth. In a nut shell they sold me a dead amp and then laughed in my face about it. If this is how your business treats customers, don't expect to be a business for long. I attempted a purchase with Bailey Brothers about 8 years ago. Was not a pleasant experience. This one wasn't either. Rest assured, that's it. I will not be back.

Update: Hey the owner called me just to prove they really do not care about customers. Tried to minimize what happened, and basically acted exactly like Keith did. Also a robotic "I apologize but we're not going to do anything to fix it" does not count as rectifying anything. Gee wonder why the Southside store closed! Oh yeah and if you have a bad experience with them and they don't own up to it they'll do like any typical teenager does and tries to badmouth you on Facebook, then stalk your page. Very mature. Screenshots are great though aren't they?

PS: Oh and buddy, if I were mad and desperate to pay my rent, then why in the heck did I buy a $700 amp from you? Nice try.

name: jbs3301
text: Over the years I habe purchased thousands of dollarsof gear from Bailey Brothers. I have always found the owner and staff to be knowledgeable and courteous. I have found their prices to be competitive with national big box stores, but they offer personalized service as a family owned business that the chain stores can't. They will stand behind their product.

name: Uncle Zeb
text: I left my guitar with this store in February 2012 for a simple repair. In June it was still hanging waiting for them to repair. I had been told on multiple occasions that it would be ready in just a few days. I picked it up today June 24, 2012 and no repair has been done and I was still charged a bench fee. This place sucks. I will never go in there again. Good luck if you do.

name: Bill Young
text: Great staff, prices and awesome selection in stock! Been buying gear from them for over 20 years. Always happy!

name: Hal and Alison Ashmore
text: I have done business with these guys from day one in downtown Montgomery. I now live in Gadsden drive over an hour to their store. Always a good time and worth the drive to find what I need!

name: Todd Troulias
text: Great place for all my music needs. Friendly staff and reasonable prices.

name: Anand Iyer
text: I needed to buy instruments for my Middle School kids. They were very upfront with their prices and seemed to have the best deals.

name: Clay McCown
text: I frequently shop at this store and have always been treated well. The workers know my name and are consistently friendly and helpful with great product knowledge.

name: Mac McQueen
text: Awesome place. Feels like a real music store. Great customer service.

name: Fag Bag
text: A man asked for cheese

resp.text: Then cheese he got .

name: Sandra Lyle
text: Good service. Knowledgeable staff.  Wish there was one closer to us!

name: Mary Goodman
text: No stars really.  Not a very good merchant.  Let someone use my credit card number without the card!  Be careful!

name: Jeremiah Miller
text: Awesome store and great customer service.

name: Leon Pettway
text: I explained to them thoroughly what I needed and they sold me the opposite! It all about sells and f**k the customers needs! Stay away from the southside location!

name: SpecOpsElite
text: Bought a pop filter and its freaking amazing! Helpful and friendly Customer Service.

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
I would use profane language, but it would not adequately describe the crap this company pulled. Basically, I took my brother to trade a PRISTINE first-owner amp, and we could prove it, in for a Fender Hot Rod Deluxe, used, which is of equal value....and my brother coughed up $100.

I took off work to take him to initially buy the thing. I took off work to bring it in for repair when we discovered sticky crap on the power tubes, and I ended up working until 10PM thanks to these guys. They wanted me to take off work again, after having spent 5 hours in their store. I basically spoke up and said, he might be the customer, but I'm the wheelman, and I'm furious. I mentioned the fact of the wasted gas, wasted trips, and the at least 6 hours of driving they were expecting of me.

They checked OUR amp out very thoroughly, and even treated my brother like a criminal, saying they are getting his DL in case he stole it. SERIOUSLY people....

I tried to talk some business sense with them, asking them to do something for the trouble, and it would not have taken much. They said no. Then I asked if they can just reverse everything since ALL of the stuff was still in the store.... The guy made up a story of a law, which actually doesn't exist, then claiming he has to charge extra to reverse it all. Guitar Center evidently doesn't know about this (fake) law.

Not ONLY that, but the smug, d-bag attitude that the guy gave me when pushing my brother, his CUSTOMER aside to say "you don't think we're trying to rip you off do you?" He did this to put me on the spot, and tried to make me look like the bad guy.

In the end, my brother spent another $170 to get a new model. In the end, he got what he wanted, but we are both appalled by how the guy behaved to our faces. Beware, their used gear has NO warranty, but they represented at sale that they would ensure the gear works if something went wrong like the day we get it... Well... it did.

You don't take someone's $700 amp + $100 and then give them junk, and not try to do something proper after dragging someone thru hell. That's the bottom line. I tried more than the guy at this store. You won't catch us in that place again.

Considering the tens of thousands that my brother spent with other companies, Bailey Brothers missed an opportunity... Not good business. Dishonest, rude, and outright condescending.  Smiled at us when we expressed our frustration with the runaround....

name: Bunky Anderson
text: always has anything i need for backline company--lewis is best drum guy in town !!!!

name: Mitchel Bunting
text: This is the only location in alabama that sells Fretlight  guitars. They range from beginner to pro.and the whole neck lights up with led's  to teach you how to play.

name: JR Robison
text: always tough to leave this place without bringing something home. Great selection, awesome staff.

name: Stella Spivey
text: The people at Bailey Brothers are so nice and helping people

name: Bailey Jackson
text: Great experience at Bailey Brothers Music. Highly recommended.

name: Fletcher Louallen,Sr.
text: great

name: Ken
text: Always the best deals and best service!!!

name: Andrew Moncrief
text: Great place to purchase.

name: clay bailey
text: ALWAYS A GOOD TIME

name: Charlie Morrison
text: Don't answer the phone
